docs.text: well i'll be damned , what a most excellent surprise .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not to be confused with the campy and far inferior 1988 remake starring ex-porn star traci lords , this more recent attempt at remaking the 1950's drive-in schlockfest not of this earth is a real gem and was quite possibly the best sci-fi flick of 1995 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: once again , b-movie king roger corman is behind this effort ( he directed the original ) but this time he appears only in the role of executive producer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the rest of the crew and cast are relative unknowns .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it seems criminal that the film was released direct to video in most countries , because it's an absolute must-see for sci-fi fans and a treat for anyone who enjoys decently acted and written thrillers with a kooky bent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the plot in brief .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: paul johnson ( michael york ) is an alien posing as an eccentric millionaire who , though needing to kill people to live , is visiting earth for far from selfish reasons .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his race is dying of a mysterious blood disease and he desperately is trying to find a cure , the key of which lies in the blood of humans .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he visits and soon puts under his spell the respected blood physician dr . rochelle , whom he hypnotises into doing secret research on his behalf .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he also has the doctor convince smart and sexy nurse amanda ( elizabeth barondes ) to move in with johnson as his private nurse so as to give him the blood transfusions which he constantly requires .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but before long , amanda and johnson's sleazy chauffeur release that johnson is a lot more than just eccentric .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i must admit , my first glimpse of the video cover for not of this earth was not encouraging .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: british actor michael york has appeared in some real stinkers in past few decades , a far cry from the quality fare of his younger days such as caberat ( 1972 ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but his performance here as an alien in human disguise is nothing short of outstanding .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the weird twitches and bizarre modes of speech , the dapper clothes and cool spectacles , the unexpected pathos which he invests in his character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: york is by turns hilarious , menacing and tragic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is a tour-de-force and quite simply the best performance i've seen from him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and while obviously made on a modest budget , the film boasts enormous strengths .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the casting is spot on , the acting is terrific and the script is intelligent , witty and consistently engaging , cleverly updating the original .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the balance of horror and humour is just about perfect , a marked contrast to the earlier remake from 1988 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film doesn't drag for a second of its 90 minute running time thanks to tight editing and the sure hand of little-known director terrance h . winkless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and it doesn't matter one bit that the special effects are cheesy - this is schlock after all , even if it is high class schlock .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact my only criticism of the film is that things get a tad weak towards the end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tighter direction could have given the climax more urgency and a few of the characters act rather illogically given their life-threatening situation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but these are minor complaints .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: just see it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not of this earth is one of the biggest sci-fi surprises in years .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and michael york : in one cool swoop you've made yourself a b-movie legend , dude .
docs.label: positive
